2. Video streaming technology: Mindgeek utilizes adaptive bitrate streaming technologies, such as HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) and DASH (Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP), to deliver high-quality video content to users with varying internet connection speeds.
3. Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI): To improve content recommendation, user experience, and content moderation, Mindgeek employs AI and machine learning algorithms. These technologies help in automatic tagging, categorizing content, and providing personalized recommendations to users.
4. Big Data and Analytics: Mindgeek collects and processes massive amounts of data from its user base to gain insights into user behavior and preferences. This information is used to optimize content, user experience, and marketing strategies.
5. Cloud Computing: Mindgeek leverages cloud computing infrastructure and services to manage, store, and process data, as well as to run its applications and services.
6. Cybersecurity: As a company dealing with sensitive content and user data, Mindgeek invests heavily in cybersecurity measures to protect its websites, user data, and systems from unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security threats.
7. Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR): Mindgeek has started exploring and implementing VR and AR technologies to provide more immersive and interactive adult content experiences.
8. Payment Processing: Mindgeek utilizes secure payment processing technologies and partners with various payment providers to offer multiple payment options to its customers.

Please note that the technologies mentioned above may change over time as the company continues to evolve and adapt to new developments in the tech industry.
what are choice of programming languages used by company list out best resources to learn application security concepts for those programming languages.

Mindgeek, like many other technology companies, likely uses a variety of programming languages based on the specific needs of their projects. Some common programming languages used in the industry include:

1. Python
2. JavaScript
3. Java
4. PHP
5. Ruby
6. C#
7. Go

For each of these programming languages, there are resources available to learn application security concepts. Below is a list of resources for each language:

1. Python:
	* Book: "Black Hat Python" by Justin Seitz
	* OWASP Python Security Project: <https://owasp.org/www-project-python-security/>
	* Secure coding with Python (YouTube playlist): <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKI1h_nAkaQoDzGe4_pk-NCk8KsbQdiyc>
2. JavaScript:
	* Book: "Web Application Security: Exploitation and Countermeasures for JavaScript Apps" by Andrew Hoffman
	* OWASP Cheat Sheet Series - DOM based XSS Prevention Cheat Sheet: <https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/DOM_based_XSS_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html>
	* Node.js Security Handbook: <https://snyk.io/learn/node-js-security-handbook/>
3. Java:
	* Book: "Iron-Clad Java: Building Secure Web Applications" by Jim Manico and August Detlefsen
	* OWASP Java Security Project: <https://owasp.org/www-project-java-security/>
	* Secure Coding Guidelines for Java SE: <https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/seccodeguide.html>
4. PHP:
	* Book: "Securing PHP Web Applications" by Tricia Ballad and William Ballad
	* OWASP PHP Security Cheat Sheet: <https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/PHP_Security_Cheat_Sheet.html>
	* PHP: The Right Way (Security): <https://phptherightway.com/#security>
5. Ruby:
	* Book: "Secure Your Node.js Web Application" by Karl Duuna (relevant for Ruby developers as well)
	* OWASP Ruby on Rails Security Guide: <https://guides.rubyonrails.org/security.html>
	* Rails Security Best Practices: <https://www.railstutorial.org/book/security>
6. C#:
	* Book: "C# and .NET Core Test-Driven Development" by Dr. Vivina Bartram (includes security testing)
	* OWASP .NET Security Cheat Sheet: <https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/DotNet_Security_Cheat_Sheet.html>
	* Microsoft's Security Best Practices for C#: <https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/security/secure-coding-guidelines>
7. Go:
	* Book: "Black Hat Go" by Tom Steele, Chris Patten, and Dan Kottmann
	* Go Secure Coding Practices: <https://github.com/OWASP/Go-SCP>
	* Go Security Cheatsheet: <https://github.com/OWASP/CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/Go_Security_Cheat_Sheet.md>

Keep in mind that application security concepts extend beyond specific programming languages. It's essential to familiarize yourself with general security best practices and principles, such as the OWASP Top Ten Project (<https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/>) and OWASP Cheat Sheet Series (<https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/>).

Provide most common technical questions asked for application security role to prepare for Mindgeek's technical interview

Here are some common technical questions that you may be asked during an application security interview at Mindgeek or any other company:

1. What is the OWASP Top Ten? Can you briefly explain some of the most critical web application security risks?
2. What is SQL injection? How can you prevent it in web applications?
3. What are Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks? Explain the difference between Stored XSS, Reflected XSS, and DOM-based XSS.
4. What is Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)? How can you mitigate CSRF attacks?
5. Explain the concept of session hijacking and session fixation. How can you secure user sessions in a web application?
6. What is the Same-Origin Policy? How does it help protect web applications from security threats?
7. What are Content Security Policy (CSP) and its benefits? How can you implement CSP in a web application?
8. What is a secure development lifecycle (SDLC)? Describe the stages and the role of security in each stage.
9. What are some best practices for securely storing passwords in a web application?
10. What is the difference between encryption, hashing, and encoding? Provide examples of when to use each.
11. What are some common web application security testing tools and techniques?
12. Explain the concept of input validation and output encoding. How do they help prevent security vulnerabilities in web applications?
13. What are the main types of web application firewalls (WAF), and how do they work?
14. What is the role of threat modeling in application security? Describe some common threat modeling methodologies.
15. Can you explain public key infrastructure (PKI) and how it is used to secure communication on the internet?

Remember that interviewers may also ask scenario-based questions or ask you to perform hands-on exercises to assess your problem-solving abilities and practical knowledge of application security. It's essential to be well-prepared and practice answering questions like these to be successful in a technical interview for an application security role.
